item.title: Tax Bill’s Bid to Ban New AI Rules Faces Bipartisan Blowback
item.description: A Republican attempt to block states from enforcing new artificial intelligence rules over the next decade has drawn growing bipartisan objections, exposing tension in Washington over allowing for more unchecked AI development.The proposal, buried on pages 278 and 279 in the sweeping tax bill passed by the House last month, has drawn sharp criticism from Republican Representative Marjorie Taylor Greene and Senator Marsha Blackburn, as well as Democratic Senators Ed Markey and Elizabeth Warren. M
item.dc:creator: Jackie Davalos

media:content.media:description: Representative Marjorie Taylor Greene, a Republican from Georgia and chair of the House Oversight Subcommittee on Delivering on Government Efficiency (DOGE), during a hearing in Washington, DC, US, on Wednesday, Feb. 12, 2025. The subcommittee is holding its first hearing, titled "The War On Waste: Stamping Out the Scourge of Improper Payments and Fraud."

item.title: China’s Didi Swings Back to Profit After Global Business Revs Up
item.description: Didi Global Inc. returned to profit in the March quarter, a boost for a Chinese ride-hailing leader gearing up for a potential Hong Kong market debut.
item.dc:creator: John Liu, Claire Che

media:content.media:description: The logo of Didi Global Inc. on a smartphone.

item.title: US Is Reworking Subsidy Awards to Chipmakers, Lutnick Says
item.description: US Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick said the Trump administration has been reworking agreements forged with semiconductor makers under the 2022 Chips Act to secure what he called better terms aimed at generating additional domestic investment.
item.dc:creator: Alicia Diaz

media:content.media:description: A bare wafer stacker sorts silicon wafers in Building 51 at Micron Technology Inc. headquarters in Boise, Idaho, US, on Monday, June 10, 2024. The US announced in April its plans to award Micron Technology Inc. $6.1 billion in grants and as much as $7.5 billion in loans to help the memory-chip maker build new American factories, rounding out a slew of major federal awards for advanced semiconductor manufacturing. Photographer: Kyle Green/Bloomberg

item.title: US Plans Wider China Tech Curbs Targeting Subsidiaries
item.description: The Trump administration plans to broaden restrictions on China’s tech sector with new regulations to capture subsidiaries of companies under US curbs.
item.dc:creator: Mackenzie Hawkins, Jenny Leonard

media:content.media:description: A wafer on display at the Semicon China expo in Shanghai, China, on Wednesday, March 20, 2024. The expo runs through March 22.

item.title: Uber, DoorDash Settle Delivery Fee Cap Dispute With New York
item.description: DoorDash Inc., Grubhub Inc. and Uber Technologies Inc.’s Uber Eats are settling a 2021 lawsuit against New York City over a cap on fees the meal-delivery services can charge restaurants.
item.dc:creator: Malathi Nayak

item.title: Nintendo’s Switch 2 Lures Fans to Biggest Gadget Launch in Years
item.description: Nintendo Co. fans from Tokyo to Manhattan stood in line for hours to be among the first to get a Switch 2, fueling one of the biggest global gadget debuts since the iPhone launches of yesteryear.
item.dc:creator: Yuki Furukawa, Cecilia D'Anastasio, Takashi Mochizuki

media:content.media:description: The Steam Deck Photographer: Kiyoshi Ota/Bloomberg

item.title: Alphabet CEO Expects to Keep Hiring Engineers as AI Advances
item.description: Alphabet Inc.’s Sundar Pichai said his company will keep expanding its engineering ranks at least into 2026, stressing human talent remains key even as Google’s parent ramps up AI investments.
item.dc:creator: Julia Love

media:content.media:description: Sundar Pichai Photographer: David Paul Morris/Bloomberg

item.title: Meta’s Push Into Defense Tech Reflects Cultural Shift, CTO Says
item.description: Meta Platforms Inc. Chief Technology Officer Andrew Bosworth said that the “tides have turned” in Silicon Valley and made it more palatable for the tech industry to support the US military’s efforts.
item.dc:creator: Riley Griffin

media:content.media:description: Andrew Bosworth on June 4. Photographer: David Paul Morris/Bloomberg

item.title: 23andMe’s DNA Data Gets Boosted $305 Million Bid in New Auction
item.description: Bankrupt genetic analysis company 23andMe will hold a second auction for its cache of DNA data with an opening bid of $305 million from group lead by the company’s former chief executive officer, Anne Wojcicki.
item.dc:creator: Steven Church

media:content.media:description: Anne Wojcicki

item.title: IBM Said to Have Pursued Informatica Ahead of Salesforce Deal
item.description: International Business Machines Corp. pursued Informatica Inc. before Salesforce Inc. bought the software company for $8 billion last month, according to people familiar with the matter.
item.dc:creator: Liana Baker, Brody Ford

media:content.media:description: The Informatica headquarters in Redwood City, California, US, on Monday, April 29, 2024. Informatica Inc. is scheduled to release earrings figures on May 1. Photographer David Paul Morris/Bloomberg Photographer: David Paul Morris/Bloomberg

item.title: Elon Musk’s AI Startup Set to Get Debt Backing From TPG
item.description: TPG Angelo Gordon is an anchor investor in a debt package for Elon Musk’s artificial intelligence startup, xAI Corp., according to people with knowledge of the matter.
item.dc:creator: Jill R Shah, Rachel Graf

item.title: Nvidia Director Discloses Proposal to Sell $550 Million Position
item.description: Billionaire Nvidia Corp. director Mark Stevens unloaded more than 1 million shares of the chipmaker this week as the stock rebounds from a slow start to the year.
item.dc:creator: Biz Carson

media:content.media:description: The Nvidia headquarters in Santa Clara, California, US, on Tuesday, Nov. 19, 2024. Nvidia Corp. is scheduled to release earnings figures on November 20. Photographer: David Paul Morris/Bloomberg

item.title: Japanese Space-Debris Firm Loses Half Its Value a Year After IPO
item.description: When Astroscale Holdings Inc. began trading in Tokyo a year ago, excitement over the Japanese space-debris pioneer was riding so high that the stock surged 62%, making it a billion-dollar company.
item.dc:creator: Yasutaka Tamura, Reina Sasaki

media:content.media:description: Astroscale Holdings CEO Nobu Okada, second right, attends the company’s listing ceremony at the Tokyo Stock Exchange in June 2024.

item.title: Deliveroo Launches Drone Food Delivery Service in Dublin
item.description: Deliveroo has launched an autonomous drone food delivery service in Dublin in partnership with Irish firm Manna Drones Inc.
item.dc:creator: Jennifer Duggan

media:content.media:description: A Deliveroo Manna food delivery drone. Source: Deliveroo

item.title: TikTok Rival RedNote’s Value Hits $26 Billion in Boost for GSR
item.description: Xiaohongshu’s valuation surged to $26 billion in recent market transactions via a major fund, an unusually fast ascent that underscores how the Chinese social media phenom is making headway against TikTok in the US.
item.dc:creator: Echo Wong

media:content.media:description: The Xiaohongshu application. Photographer: Raul Ariano/Bloomberg

item.title: Apple Loses Bid to Pause Court Order on App Store Changes
item.description: Apple Inc. lost its request to pause a court order requiring it to let App Store developers steer users to the web to purchase in-app items without paying a commission.
item.dc:creator: Josh Sisco, Mark Gurman

media:content.media:description: The Apple App Store app on a smartphone arranged in New York, US, on Tuesday, June 25, 2024. Apple Inc. risks billions of euros of new fines over its App Store rules as European Union antitrust regulators escalated a growing conflict over rules that strike at the heart of the iPhone makers business model. Photographer: Gabby Jones/Bloomberg

item.title: Best Buy, GameStop Expect Rapid Sellout of Switch 2 Consoles
item.description: Best Buy Co. expects to sell out its allotment of Nintendo Co.’s new Switch 2 game consoles shortly after they become available for purchase at midnight.
item.dc:creator: Cecilia D'Anastasio

media:content.media:description: A person holds of the new Nintendo Switch 2 video-game console system. Photographer: Dimitar Dilkoff/AFP/Getty Images

item.title: Tesla FSD's Role in Crash, GlobalFoundries Ups US Spend | Bloomberg Technology 6/4/2025
item.description: Bloomberg’s Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow discuss footage and details from late 2023 when a Tesla using what the company calls Full Self-Driving (FSD) was in a fatal crash. Plus, GlobalFoundries CEO Tim Breen talks about his company’s plans to spend $16 billion to boost chip production in New York and Vermont. And HPE CEO Antonio Neri explains why the company has reduced how much it expects tariffs to impact earnings. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Chinese Hacked US Telecom a Year Before Known Wireless Breaches
item.description: Corporate investigators found evidence that Chinese hackers broke into an American telecommunications company in the summer of 2023, indicating the country’s attackers penetrated the US communications system earlier than publicly known.
item.dc:creator: Jake Bleiberg

media:content.media:description: hacker, hackers, rf — Close up of hands typing on laptop. Night work concept Photographer: Witthaya Prasongsin/Moment RF

item.title: Planet Labs CEO Says Europe Demand Beating Outset of Ukraine War
item.description: Earth imaging company Planet Labs PBC’s profit beat expectations as Europe hikes defense spending in response to the United States pulling back from the continent.
item.dc:creator: Ignacio Gonzalez

media:content.media:description: A rendering of a Pelican satellite that is used for Planet Labs imaging.

item.title: Reddit Sues Anthropic, Says AI Company Exploited User Data
item.description: Reddit Inc. sued artificial intelligence firm Anthropic, saying it has used the social media company’s content without permission to train its AI models.
item.dc:creator: Riley Griffin, Shirin Ghaffary

media:content.media:description: The Reddit application on the Apple Inc. App Store arranged on a smartphone in Sydney, Australia, on Thursday, Nov. 28, 2024. Australia’s plan to ban social media for children under the age of 16 is expected to pass parliament Thursday.

item.title: FCC Departures Gut Panel With Big Merger, Investigation Pending
item.description: Two members of the Federal Communications Commission announced they’ll depart this week, leaving the agency with three vacancies while it reviews a major media merger and investigates a wireless provider.
item.dc:creator: Kelcee Griffis

media:content.media:description: A woman exits the Federal Communications Commission (FCC) headquarters in Washington, D.C., U.S., on Tuesday, July 11, 2017. On Wednesday, the big online commercial sites including Amazon.com, Google, Facebook and Twitter will join scores of online activists and businesses in telling users about the Republican plan to roll back net neutrality rules and ask the visitors to contact Congress and the FCC to stop from gutting the rule against interfering with web traffic. Photographer: Andrew Harrer/Bloomberg

item.title: Cyber Investigators Examine Video of Alleged Hackers on a Jet
item.dc:creator: Jake Bleiberg

media:content.media:description: Marco Rubio, US secretary of state, during a Senate Appropriations Subcommittee on State, Foreign Operations, and Related Programs hearing in Washington, DC, US, on Tuesday, May 20, 2025. The hearing is reviewing the fiscal year 2026 budget request for the US Department of State. Photographer: Nathan Howard/Bloomberg

item.title: CrowdStrike Says DOJ, SEC Sent Inquiries on Firm Accounting
item.description: CrowdStrike Holdings Inc. said US officials have asked for information related to the accounting of deals it’s made with some customers and said the cybersecurity firm is cooperating with the inquiry.
item.dc:creator: Jake Bleiberg

media:content.media:description: The CrowdStrike offices in Sunnyvale, California, US, on Friday, July 19, 2024. In what will go down as the most spectacular IT failure the world has ever seen, a botched software update from cybersecurity firm CrowdStrike Holdings Inc. crashed countless Microsoft Windows computer systems globally. Photographer: Benjamin Fanjoy/Bloomberg

item.title: Italy to Strengthen STMicro, Not Tear It Apart, Minister Says
item.description: Italy intends to strengthen embattled semiconductor company STMicroelectronics NV, a joint venture with France, Industry Minister Adolfo Urso said.
item.dc:creator: Donato Paolo Mancini

media:content.media:description: STMicroelectronics in Crolles, France.

item.title: Capital Group, Kushner’s Thrive Visited China to Study AI Scene
item.description: Joshua Kushner’s Thrive Capital and investment firm Capital Group have in recent months visited China to learn about its AI industry, joining a growing number of US investors rekindling interest in the country after DeepSeek’s advances stunned Silicon Valley.
item.dc:creator: Lulu Yilun Chen

media:content.media:description: Joshua Kushner

item.title: Organized Crime Phishing Took £47 Million From UK Coffers
item.description: Organized crime has extracted £47 million ($64 million) from the UK government in a phishing operation, His Majesty’s Revenue and Customs officials said Wednesday.The operation, which took place last year, involved mimicking taxpayer credentials and claiming payments from HMRC, Angela MacDonald, second permanent secretary and deputy chief executive, told Parliament’s Treasury Committee. The incident wasn’t a cyberattack and no data from taxpayers was taken, she said.

media:content.media:description: HM Revenue and Customs building on Whitehall, London, UK. (Photo by: Alex Segre/UCG/Universal Images Group via Getty Images) Photographer: UCG/Universal Images Group Editorial

item.title: AI-Power Demand Leads Brokerage Snapper to Hire Team
item.description: Commodity brokerage Snapper Creek Energy has built a power team focused on rising volatility in electricity markets as artificial intelligence and extreme weather upend grids.
item.dc:creator: Josh Saul

media:content.media:description: Data center cabling.

item.title: Samsung’s Galaxy S25 Edge Shows the Limits of Impressively Thin Phones
item.description: Review: The handset, one of several slim devices coming this year, skimps on battery life for the sake of a light design.
item.dc:creator: Chris Welch

media:content.media:description: Samsung Galaxy S25 Edge.

item.title: CrowdStrike Shares Drop After Sales Forecast Underwhelms
item.description: Shares of CrowdStrike Holdings Inc. fell after the cybersecurity company projected revenue for the current period that trailed estimates, in its first financial update since announcing it would cut about 5% of its global workforce.
item.dc:creator: Jake Bleiberg

media:content.media:description: Crowdstrike Holdings Inc. signage on the floor of the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) in New York, US, on Monday, July 22, 2024. Stocks rebounded after their worst week since April as investors looked beyond Joe Biden ending his reelection campaign to focus on the start of the tech earnings season. Photographer: Michael Nagle/Bloomberg
